title.narrative: Enhancing The Planning Capacities Of Cities In The Nacala Corridor (Nampula, Tete And Nacala)

description.narrative:
The project aims to support local authorities along the Nacala corridor in the development and implementation of sound planning instruments integrating legal and economic aspects. Specifically, this project intends to address the above issues in the following way:Strengthen the capacity of the Planning Support Unit (PSU) and build its credibility as an autonomous institution that provides fit-for-purpose services to cities and towns along the Nacala corridor in the field of urban planning. In particular, through the PSU and with the support of UN-Habitat HQ, attention will be placed on Nampula, Nacala and Tete to develop (or, in the case of Nacala, to finalise) planned city extension, resilient urban growth plans and action plans for prioritization of investments. In addition, conditions will be created to develop a spatial development strategy for the whole corridor.
Maximise the ability of the city authorities of Nampula, Nacala and Tete to plan and sustainably manage urban growth through durable access to technical advice, public-private platforms and on-the-job capacity building. The idea will be to effectively capture the economic value of the target cities in the territorial regulatory instruments so that investments can benefit larger sections of the populations of Tete, Nampula and Nacala.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Office for Project Services

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: By the end of the project, the Planning Support Unit (PSU) based in Nampula is much strengthened compared to today with qualified and readily available technical capacities in order to provide municipalities in Nampula, Nacala and Tete with sustainable and resilient urban growth plans

description.narrative: By the end of the project, the Planning Support Unit (PSU) based in Nampula is much strengthened compared to today with qualified and readily available technical capacities in order to provide municipalities in Nampula, Nacala and Tete with sustainable and resilient urban growth plans

title.narrative: 1.1 Number of qualified staff in the PSU has increased 1.2 Rapid Resilience Assessments are carried out for the cities of Nacala, Nampula and Tete. 1.3 Detailed city diagnostics are provided for Nacala, Nampula and Tete. 1.4 Resilience Action Plans are developed for Nacala and Tete 1.1.5 Planned city extensions are developed for Nampula, Nacala and Tete.

description.narrative: 1.1 Number of qualified staff in the PSU has increased 1.2 Rapid Resilience Assessments are carried out for the cities of Nacala, Nampula and Tete. 1.3 Detailed city diagnostics are provided for Nacala, Nampula and Tete. 1.4 Resilience Action Plans are developed for Nacala and Tete 1.1.5 Planned city extensions are developed for Nampula, Nacala and Tete.

baseline.value:
1.1.1 Only 2 qualified staff in PSU
1.1.2 No resilience assessments
1.1.3 No detailed city diagnostics
1.1.4 No resilience action plans
1.1.5 No planned city extensions

target.value:
1.1.1 At least 5 qualified staff in PSU
1.1.2 Three rapid resilience assessments
1.1.3 Three city diagnostics
1.1.4 three resilience action plans
1.1.5 three planned city extensions

title.narrative: EA2 By the end of the project, the economic value of the target areas is better captured in the territorial regulatory instruments so that investments can benefit larger sections of the populations of Tete, Nampula and Nacala.

description.narrative: EA2 By the end of the project, the economic value of the target areas is better captured in the territorial regulatory instruments so that investments can benefit larger sections of the populations of Tete, Nampula and Nacala.

title.narrative: • Number of private firms involved/consulted in planning activities carried out by the municipalities. • Number of socially responsible partnerships initiated between the municipalities and private firms. • Percentage of existing and new plans that can count on a commitment for partial financing by the private sector

description.narrative: • Number of private firms involved/consulted in planning activities carried out by the municipalities. • Number of socially responsible partnerships initiated between the municipalities and private firms. • Percentage of existing and new plans that can count on a commitment for partial financing by the private sector

baseline.value:
1.1.1 No private firms involved in the urban planning activities of the 3 targeted cities
1.1.2 No socially responsible partnerships initiated
1.1.3 0% financing of approved urban plans by the private sector

target.value:
1.1.1 At least 3 private firms involved in each city
1.1.2 At least one socially responsible partnership initiated per city
1.1.3 At least 10% of the approved urban plans financed by the private sector in each city
